subject: Philosophy
title: Existential Courage
description: A quick, practical guide to Existential Courage.

hook.text: Paul Tillich called it 'the courage to be' â€” affirming yourself despite meaninglessness and death.

buildup.text: Existential courage isn't physical bravery. It's the will to live authentically in an uncertain world.

discovery.text: It means making commitments knowing they might fail, loving knowing you'll lose, creating knowing it won't last.

twist.text: Avoiding risk isn't safety â€” it's a different kind of death. Playing it safe is its own loss.

climax.text: Existential courage accepts vulnerability as the price of a genuine life.

punchline.text: Living fully requires the courage to lose everything.

quiz.question: What did Paul Tillich mean by 'the courage to be'?
options: Affirming yourself despite uncertainty and meaninglessness
